channel.title: Openstruct on T[h]ink]er[ing

item.title: Ruby-like struct in Python #2
item.description: Ruby provides a very handy type called OpenStruct to create objects. It brings the opportunity to add fields to objects during the runtime. Here is its Python counterpart. In the previous post I showed Struct from esu which helps creating new types with fields and methods. That has a sibling, called OpenStruct which helps creating objects on the fly. Usage Ruby’s OpenStruct (doc:2.6.5) inspired it, and it looks as follows.
